metadata.title: CVE-2022-27943 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - low
metadata.description:
libiberty/rust-demangle.c in GNU GCC 11.2 allows stack consumption indemangle_const, as demonstrated by nm-new.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27943` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.39-1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.39-1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.39-1

criterions.comment: gcc-11 package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-arm-none-eabi package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-avr package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-h8300-hms package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-mingw-w64 package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
gcc-opt package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
binutils package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.39-1').
gdb package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.2-1ubuntu1').
gcc-12 package in noble is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-13 package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.2.0-2').
